title: Josh Mantellato
text:
Josh Mantellato (born 21 April 1987) is an <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Italy</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays on the for the Entrance Tigers in the Denton Engineering Cup. He previously played for the <a href="Wyong%20Roos">Wyong Roos</a> in the <a href="Central%20Coast%20Division%20Rugby%20League">Central Coast Division Rugby League</a> competition, <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a> and the <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>.
Background.
Mantellato was born in <a href="Gosford">Gosford</a>, <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a>, Australia and is of <a href="Italians">Italian</a> descent.
He played his junior rugby league for the <a href="Wyong%20Roos">Wyong Roos</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
Up until 2011, Mantellato played for the <a href="Wyong%20Roos">Wyong Roos</a> in the <a href="Newcastle%20Rugby%20League">Newcastle Rugby League</a>.
2010.
In 2010, Mantellato made his international debut for <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Italy</a>.
2012.
In 2012, Mantellato joined the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>' <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a> team, finishing the season as the competition's highest point-scorer, with 306 points. On 12 September 2012, he was named on the wing in the 2012 <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a> Team of the Year. He then signed a 1-year contract with the Knights.
2013.
In Round 12 of the <a href="2013%20NRL%20season">2013 NRL season</a>, Mantellato made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for the Knights against the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a>. He scored a try and kicked 3 goals on debut. On 20 August 2013, he re-signed with the Knights on a 1-year contract. On 22 September 2013, he was again named on the wing in the 2013 <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a> Team of the Year. During 2013, he featured in Italy's successful <a href="2013%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20qualifying">2013 Rugby League World Cup qualifying</a> tournament and was selected in the 24-man squad for the <a href="2013%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">World Cup</a> campaign. On 19 October 2013, he kicked the winning field goal in Italy's 15-14 warm up game win over <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>.
2014.
On 21 September 2014, Mantellato was named on the wing in the 2014 <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a> Team of the Year for the third year in a row.
2015.
On 11 August 2014, Mantellato signed a 3-year contract with <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> club, <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>, starting in 2015. He made his Super League debut in Round 1 against the <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a>. He kicked off his Super League points tally by kicking 5 goals in their 30-40 first round defeat. He scored his first two Super League tries against the <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a> in Round 3.
2017.
In January, Mantellato returned to Australia to play for <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a> feeder club, Wyong Roos on a 1-year contract following the relegation of Hull Kingston Rovers to the <a href="Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">Kingstone Press Championship</a>.
2018.
Mantellato spent 2018 playing for Wyong in the <a href="Intrust%20Super%20Premiership%20NSW">Intrust Super Premiership NSW</a>. At the end of the season it was announced that Wyong would not be competing in the competition in 2019 as the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a> ended their agreement for Wyong to be their feeder side instead choosing foundation club <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">North Sydney</a> as the new feeder side.
